messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] time flies
messages.msgSnippet: We live close to KC and go to the Nelson quite a bit. The Kemper Art Museum is small but usually pretty good and is free. It s just a couple of blocks west of
messages.messageBody:
We live close to KC and go to the Nelson quite a bit. The Kemper Art
Museum is small but usually pretty good and is free. It's just a couple
of blocks west of the Nelson. :-) Jane

-----Original Message-----
From: Dnowens@... [mailto:Dnowens@...]
Sent: Thursday, August 22, 2002 5:40 AM
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] time flies

In a message dated 8/21/02 11:53:17 PM Central Daylight Time,
jane@...
writes:


> One of the coolest websites about time I've ever found. Has some heavy
> duty graphics and I have no idea what the download time would be like
> with dial up but enjoy! ~Jane
>
> http://www.nelson-atkins.org/tempusfugit/

The download on dial up wasn't too bad! <g> I love going to the
Nelson-Atkins
Museum! In fact, we are planing a trip to KC sometime this fall to take
the
kids there and to Science City. Now that admissions at Nelson are
free... it
makes the trip so much better. <g>
~Nancy

Or how about "Heathers"?

-Lisa

messages.subject: Re: Movies about Highschool Cruelty
messages.msgSnippet: It s a book, not a movie, and it s definitely Christian, but I am reading a book called The Wounded Spirit by Frank Peretti.  I m only half way through it, but
messages.messageBody:
It's a book, not a movie, and it's definitely Christian, but I am
reading a book called The Wounded Spirit by Frank Peretti. I'm only
half way through it, but in the first few chapters he describes
incredible cruelty that he endured at school. The first chapter
starts out by talking about these terrible things and it makes you
think he's describing some type of juvenile prison and then you find
out he's talking about his school. I'm anxious to see where he goes
with it...I'm tempted to write him a letter and explain the freedom
that unschoolers have from that kind of school cruelty!
Sheila
